website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for an affordable smart plug that works with Alexa, this one is good but not the best.
pros: The Amazon Smart Plug is affordable and it seamlessly integrates into the Alexa platform, thanks to Wi-Fi Simple Setup
cons: You won't get power monitoring, away modes or compatibility with any other voice assistants

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Alzheimer's Patients / Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Got this smart plug so I can remotely turn appliances/lights on and off in an Alzheimer's patient's home. I can remotely make sure things are off by simply turning them on/off in the Amazon Alexa app - super simple to use and really helps me out. Now I don't have to drive over there to make sure the lights are off, or the AC or TV are off, etc. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Wright

customer_reviews.title: Yes I did have a set up problem.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone else have a problem? Surprised that the instructions (hard copy and online) were not complete. Did not tell you that the plug needed to be turned on in a specific way to allow for setting the plug up---" press and hold the on/off switch until the LED light flashes blue and red." After that, the set up process was simple.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern

customer_reviews.title: Issues...Amazon attempting to resolve for me...VERY IMPRESSED GUYS!
customer_reviews.text: Ran great the first night I set it up....then, I experienced issues as other folks are having, but Amazon Staff on the Alexa boards are failing to help. Many people are having issues the next day...Alexa fails to recognize device....then when attempting to rediscover plug per Amazon Staff suggestion, device fails to be discovered. Edit..... Although device is not working, Amazon support has been working with me to resolve this issue. I'm pretty impressed! Good job ! Edit 11-1-18 Recieved 2nd Amazon plug. Same issue as first plug...loses connectivity. I also recieved 2 tp link plugs that connected flawlessly and don't lose connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N.

customer_reviews.title: High Pitched Noise
customer_reviews.text: Connected beautifully to my amazon Alexa but unfortunately when you plug it in, it produces a high pitched noise that is extremely irritating. Going to return instantly. Update: Amazon had great customer service that replaced these plugs to see if they were defective in the first place. Today I received them and unfortunately they still have a high pitched buzz.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: I’m just disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this. I bought this for my keurig, but because it needs to be touched to preheat it didn’t work. My back up plan was the tv. Nope...doesn’t work for that either. Please keep in mind this can only be used for items that can stay on constantly. Example a basic coffee maker, lamp, scenty, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Total Fail
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 Echo devices, including two that have hub capability. Currently, I have a range of WeMo plugs and Philips lights such that my home is fully automated in terms of lighting. My phone calls are all routed to echo devices. In other words, I am not a novice user. None of the setup option worked with this plug. It didn't auto-connect, it could not be discovered or added via the Alexa app, and even in manual setup per the instructions (hold the power button until flashing green and blue), it would not find the plug. Terrible! Never had a single issue with my WeMo devices, and I'll be going back. So will this faulty Alexa plug.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest smart plug ever! You just plug it in and open the Alexa app. That’s it! It’s ready to use! Unlike other smart plugs that are sitting in my drawer because it was impossible to connect them to my WiFi, and forget help from customer service, it worked immediately. Simple and worth the purchase. One more thing Alexa can now do for me.
customer_reviews.author: Betty J

customer_reviews.title: Unrecognized Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Did not immediately recognize my wifi. I had to input wifi name manually, no biggie. However, remember to also enter wifi password via "security" option as part of plug set-up. Once both are correctly entered, all worked well. Will buy 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection every few days
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this plug handles 50% more power than most smart plugs. That means it will drive the coffee maker or espresso machine. However, after having this for two weeks, it has lost its connection twice already. My other smart plugs don’t have this problem. It is sitting right next to an echo and across the room from a WiFi router so no excuses here. Too bad, it’s going back. Amazon has to beef up this connection.
customer_reviews.author: pez

customer_reviews.title: Cannot schedule a routine to turn on/off with sunset/sunrise
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use this plug to schedule on/off based on the ever changing time of sunset and sunrise, do not buy it. I have several Wemo smart plugs and Hue light bulbs in my house that can be scheduled in this manner. This is a major Amazon Echo skill routine flaw that must be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Works with what?
customer_reviews.text: Been in the hi-tech and computer business for over 30 years. This one counts as one of the most frustrating cluster-doodles I have seen in a long time. Little to no information, a plethora of useless BS apps, none of which say Amazon, and apparently developers who don't know the difference between Bluetooth and WiFi. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Harold M. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Works-Edited
customer_reviews.text: The plug was super easy to install. But one day, about two to three weeks after I got it the plug it suddenly just stopped working. I get "Device is unresponsive" when I view it on the Alexa app. I was so looking forward to having this, especially being able to bypass some of the third party software that other device manufacturers use. Update Nov 6, 2018: Amazon contacted me and stayed on the phone with me until the problem was resolved. It was my network. All 2.4 GHz connections were disabled. Reset the router and the plug works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2. Did everything on package, emailed customer service, did everything they suggested. Called customer service, same steps, no luck. Exchanged for 2 more. Same scenario. Purchasing another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: The smart plug worked for two days and then became unresponsive. Tried everything to get it to work. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Plug!
customer_reviews.text: I had another plug from a different manufacturer and it was pretty great but on one TV, it would not turn on my tv it would just turn it off. With THIS plug, I set it up which was fairly simple. Guess what happened? It actually turned on and off my tv and it has been doing it with 100% accuracy since I set it up a few weeks ago. FEEDBACK FOR THIS DEVICE TO AMAZON: Sell this as a multipack.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought two plugs they worked the first day which was great because I was was going away for a week and wanted to make sure I could control them while I was away. They never worked during that period. When I go back home they still indicated that they were not responding to my app. Removed them a chalked it up as a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Munsey

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Alexa but that is it
customer_reviews.text: The setup was easy and it does exactly what it says it does but nothing more. You cannot integrate this with any other smart home hubs or services (like SmartThings, IFTTT, Stringify, etc). You can do some very basic automation using Alexa routines but those are missing some fundamental building blocks for triggers and times (no sunrise/sunset for example). But you can say "Alexa, turn on <name of plug>" and it will turn on. Neat. I got this as a $5 add on with an Echo Dot. I would not pay any more than that for it. Look elsewhere for other smart plugs that are useful in many more ways.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Totally Fun and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I love these plugs! They were so easy to install and they work seamlessly with the Amazon Alexa app. Are these plugs more expensive than other "smart plugs" on the market? Yes, very much so. However, you don't have to install these plugs via a different app and then connect to Alexa. Using these plugs is one smooth installation. They are so much fun and allows my "Alexa" environment to become more useful for me. I especially like using these plugs for plugs and lights that are near the floor so I don't have to bend down to turn them on. I can see these plugs being useful for people who have limited mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting your promo credit.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there is a disconnect between Amazon promotions and Amazon Customer Service. The promotion for a 24 dollar credit from Amazon doesn't exist according to Amazon unless you have a screenshot of the promotion. Once you buy the smart plug, the promotion dissapears. Do yourself a favor and take a screenshot if you're buying this due to the promo. Otherwise, you will end up like the rest of us, calling asking about a promo and they have no idea what you are talking about. As for the item itself, it works okay. A little issue getting it connected.
customer_reviews.author: ThaSwampDonkey

customer_reviews.title: Two Words "Device Unresponsive"
customer_reviews.text: is annoying the smart plug get unresponsive on regular basis Sometimes they work but most of the time "Devive Unresponsive" some threat mentioned that it need to have FIX IP addresses, it did not solve the issue. cost them $5.00 each - but if Amazon is planning to use as an introduction of Smart House I will not use them I will prefer to keep using my Z wave in wall Dimmer switch or zwave smart plugs and have the Zwave hub with all the hiccup between Alexa and the Zwave hub. I guess the product is not quite there.
customer_reviews.author: aquiles

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work with mesh networks, on 5g or extenders
customer_reviews.text: I own a TP link wall plug that works all the time without disconnecting. I purchased a bunch of echo’s on Black Friday with amazon plugs and regret it, because they don’t work on my eero network. My home network has multiple access points around my home for range quality and that’s probably why amazon plug is disconnecting. It should be better, to be honest. If they are competing with TP link’s quality, they really should fix this problem. If I would have known, I would have bought more TP link plugs for the same deal. Don’t bother with these unless you have a single connection in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Illusionz

customer_reviews.title: You wont get your credit
customer_reviews.text: Read the other negative reviews. Amazon offered a $24.00 credit with the purchase of this device when activated, which honestly I was going to use to buy a second because its way over priced., but you wont get it. It was fairly easy to hook up though I wished I didn't have to download the app to my phone. Dont understand why I couldn't just work from the amazon alexa site.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lowder

customer_reviews.title: Fast, simple installation and setup.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a simple smart plug to work with your Amazon Alexa devices, this plug is extremely inexpensive and easy to install. Install and setup took around 3 minutes to get up and running. So far I haven't had any issues. The only downside is that this plug will NOT integrate into your other smart services, like WEMO. So if were hoping to tie this into your larger automation environment, you're barking up the wrong tree.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Won't get the $24 credit as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for $24.99, there was supposed to be a $24 credit as soon as I activated it on my alexa app, nothing. Support couldn't find the promotion apparently. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: daniel j paider

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, after some troubleshooting with Amazon tech support, which to me the best customer service that I ever had to deal with, the problem was that it would connect to my WiFi network but Alexa would say the device ( what ever name you give it) it’s not responding, some of their best tech support here in the USA called me and they found out that it was my firewall in my Comcast router/ modem that was blocking it, but now that the issue has been taking care of, it works great, I’m going to buy a few more and I know what I’m going to give my grown kids for this holiday, I definitely recommend it this product
customer_reviews.author: Ed Macias

customer_reviews.title: Amazon an empire built on deceiving and cheating proves it again. Failed to honor promotion
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plug for 24.99 and activated during promotion that 24 will be given back. But they did not, contacted customer support and they were clueless and refused, so returned the piece of junk back. Anyways getting it to get activated is a pain in the rear. Absolutely not worth 25. I returned it as usual Amazon tried to prove what priciples it is standing on. And we are stupid to support this mega corp.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Works great ...when it works.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to wait to review this until I'd been using it for several weeks. Set up was very simple - this is the first smart plug I have purchased and used. I am using it to turn on a lamp in my bedroom. Intermittently Alexa will tell me there is no lamp and/or the plug will lose it's blue light and I know it's not working properly. Kind of frustrating and not entirely sure of the cause. The price point on this is higher than other smart plugs I have seen, so I probably wouldn't purchase again until I had tried a different brand. Overall I am happy, but not overjoyed with it sometimes not working.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: This is a life changer. I have a cute little Light up tree connected to this plug. I used to have to open a cabinet, reach around until my arm was numb to access the plug. Now I just tell Alexa to turn it on & off. It was so easy to setup. Just don’t lose your setup card in case you accidentally delete the plug from your Alexa app- you’ll need the code on the back to set it up again. Wonderful product! 100% improvement from those old digital timers. I’m buying another one right now. ❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: OK, so I'm impressed...
customer_reviews.text: I was sick and tired of my old TP-link plug being "unresponsive" more often than not, so I sprung for the pricier Amazon smartplug. I was sure that I'd be wasting my evening trying to connect it, like I did with my old one. I plugged the unit in, and before I could even open the Alexa App, I got a notification on my Fire tablet that the plug was set up and ready to use! Yes, you read correctly- It. Set. Itself. Up. This is how home automation should work. All I had to do was rename it. Thank you, Amazon! Now how about discounting some multipacks of these little gems?
customer_reviews.author: MacGuyver

customer_reviews.title: Only works some of the time. Not reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I am so frustrated with these plugs. We purchased three and were so excited to use them. They work maybe 1 out 10 times. We either get an error that it’s not responding or Alexa says ok and I can hear the plug click but it doesn’t work turn the device on or off. These plugs are expensive and so not worth the price. I had faith that they would work but I’m finding them more frustrating then they are worth. I believe these will be going back to amazon until they can come up with a better product.
customer_reviews.author: srblock

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I just plugged it in and waited for it to connect which only took a minute and I fell in love with them. I just say "Alexa turn on the coffee pot". Wonderful, and easy. If you have an Alexa get a couple. I had wemo but could never get it to work. I was skeptical about getting these but I am so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Griffith-Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Can you say SCAM!!?? No promised credit given after connected to Alexis!
customer_reviews.text: Can you say SCAM!!?? This plug works well with Alexa but when I saw it on the Amazon website for $24.99, the reason I purchased it was because I saw "receive $24.00, Amazon credit once you connect to your Alexis device". So I did and there's no credit and nothing telling me how to get that credit! Disgruntled customer!!
customer_reviews.author: sakurat8

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve set up my entire house with smart switches and plugs. I’ve only used the GE Zigbee products and I’ve never had an issue. I tried two Amazon plugs and they’re garbage. Error codes and connection issues. There is an entire thread on this very issue on Amazon’s Community Help board. Update: 5 stars for Amazon’s customer service. They contacted me after reading my review offering to troubleshoot. But the plugs have already been shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler son kept messing with a mechanical timer I was using for Christmas lights, so I got this smart plug in order to set an on and off schedule through the Alexa app. Setup was easy, just followed the instructions. And I set up the schedule and it just works. Pretty simple. It turns stuff on or off. If you need something more than that, then this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Francis C.

customer_reviews.title: FAILED within four days
customer_reviews.text: Within five days after working adequately on each command the equipment FAILDED to open on commands. ALEXA acknowledged failure to open. Rebooted Wi-Fi router, FAILURE. The ALEXA rely repeated was FAILURE. Attempts at resetting by holding the side button and waiting for the "blue" signal, FAILED. Attempts to open in alternate electric wall terminal locations, FAILED. In other this is a failed purchase of a "come-on" sale. I wish for a return of my investment! I also warn others to expect FAILURE.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Lee Weagley

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your home automation set up
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly how you would expect. Love the added control, no more getting up to turn off the light when watching a movie. Lots of great ways to use this in combination with Alexa. The GPS feature allows your lights to turn on when you connect to your home wifi, no more coming into a dark home, also allows them to automatically shut off when you leave. Replaces any need for the older light timers peoe use when they go out of town or for xmas lights. There are times, maybe 5% of the time where they wont respond, normally just turn it off and on a d everything's back to normal
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Where is my rebate???
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. I bought on the premise I would get a $24 account once I hooked the device up through my Echo Show and verified it worked. How about it Amazon? I lived up to my end of the deal. Time for you to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: mrc

customer_reviews.title: Great.....when it works
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these. Every few days one or another will be "non-responsive" (an Alexa term for "It stopped working"). The solution is to take several minutes and reinstall the plug. The plugs take turns - it's not my setup; it's the plug as they all do it (one stops but the other two continue on). In the best of times it's an annoying inconvenience. If the plug controls something that's needed immediately then it's worse than a simple inconvenience. Bottom line - Undependable!
customer_reviews.author: Ed K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these plugs. Have activated just one so far to see if it works as described. PERFECT. The 1st plug was installed for a table lamp. During set-up the plug was found in ALL DEVICES and detected as "First Plug". Telling Alexa to turn on the First Plug didn't work for me, so I renamed it "Light". Now I simply tell Alexa to "turn on/off the light". Can't wait to start using the 2nd plug the lamp next to my computer. What to name it?
customer_reviews.author: GJ KAMINSKI

customer_reviews.title: Obviously only works with amazon products
customer_reviews.text: It does everything you would expect it to do, turn off a switch and turn it back on. It does its job well, the only problem is, you have to use an Amazon product (The Echo, Alexa app) to control it. For example, I can't tell my google assistant or Siri to activate the plug. I know this doesn't seem like a big deal, but cross-platform accessibility to your devices becomes very important when you have multiple devices to connect to and interact with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The special offer was not honored
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 8/29 because of a Amazon special offer. The cost was $24.99 with a credit of $24.00 after activated. I have it working and on the Alexa app like I was advised after several chats with Amazon being transferred from one person to the next all asking the same questions I finally gave up. And will be returning the plug.
customer_reviews.author: William Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: So easy I didn't actually have to do anything.
customer_reviews.text: so easy to set up, it set up itself -- only confusion was thinking I needed to do more, except it was already linked up to Alexa and everything. Off brand plugs I've tried never worked or required so many steps it was ridiculous. So worth 2x the cost to have zero pain. Between that and actual decent returns if there were issues, more pricy Amazon plugs win hands down over the draw of useless version I have.
customer_reviews.author: LKP

customer_reviews.title: Great little addition to my office
customer_reviews.text: I've setup 3 of these plugs in my office, 2 powering lights and one a fan. Now when I walk into the room in the morning I just say "Alexa, turn office on" and things are ready to go! I did have to add them to a "group" but that was painless in the app. All in all, a fantastic addition that has me considering using them elsewhere. I'd really love a light switch that Alexa could over-ride. "Alexa, turn on outside" or even "Alexa, turn on outside at dusk" (which would rule! but isn't possible today I don't think.
customer_reviews.author: James Lang

customer_reviews.title: Alexa and the plug have to be in the same room
customer_reviews.text: I actually love the plug and then again I dont cuz if you dont have Alexa in the same room you have to yell at her to get her to hear you...now mind you my apartment isnt that big, so you'd think she could hear a mouse fart but no... I dont like coming home to an unlit place so that's why Alexa and the plug i thought were perfect but if i have to scream into my place to get her to turn on the light, i can just flip the switch...the plug will be moved to a new location that doesnt strain Alexa's delicate sensibilities of doing actual work
customer_reviews.author: Jaxsen

customer_reviews.title: Instructions to set a schedule are not clear
customer_reviews.text: I simply want to set up an on and off time for the plug for my Christmas tree. I do not have a smart home or other devices I want to be on the same schedule as this plug. I simply want to schedule my Christmas tree. I can see the plug and do it manually with my iphone. I bought the plug so it would turn on and off with a schedule. I can manually activate this outlet with a wall switch for this single outlet. Therefore, the plug is not helpful without a schedule, which I have tried to setup without success. Can someone please send me clear instructions???
customer_reviews.author: Darla Popmarkoff

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up, don't even need instructions
customer_reviews.text: After buying 2 different "other" brands of smart plug, wrestling with their apps and still not succeeding in setup, I returned them both and submitted to the highway robbery price of the amazon branded one. It's almost worth 25$ per plug. Incredibly easy set up, the alexa app instantly recognizes each new plug, and you can use alexa to name it or rename it within a minute of receipt of the package. No charge time. The only downside, other than the price, is that it's only an on/off switch- it can't do anything more complicated. When they are >10$ each, I will be ecstatic with them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's Smart Plugs are the Best!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two other brands of smart plugs based on good reviews. However, I can easily give Amazon's Smart Plugs five stars and rate them higher than the competition. Why? First, they are user friendly and easy to install. It only takes seconds. Renaming them to dedicated locations for easy-to-remember use was also easy. Alexa recognized the names that I gave to the plugs immediately. Second, these smart plugs have worked 100% of the time. I now have four, and I know which ones to get if I need more. Highly Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Idaho resident

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these plugs!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed my second one and plan to order more. These plugs make any device a smart device. They are perfect for anything you don't want to physically turn off and on. I put the first on a fan in my bedroom because I frequently get hot in the middle of the night. Now, I just tell Alexa to turn my fan off or on without getting out of bed. LOVE IT! I just put a second on on my coffee pot. Works great. Easy to install. Plug in and instantly recognized by my Alexa app on my phone. I highly recommend these to anyone. They are certainly worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: sking

customer_reviews.title: Regularly “unresponsive” - - Ugh...
customer_reviews.text: So many times the plug is “unresponsive” - TP Link is a much better plug. Is return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: Default to off
customer_reviews.text: I wish I can set up this plug default to turn on the power. I bought this for a switched plug to control mt bad room lamps. It's useless because if I turn off the power from wall switch, I expect next time when I turn on the switch will turn the light on also. Instead of that, turning wall switch off and on will not turn on the plug. I have to 1. Turn on the wall switch 2. Wait until the smart plug to connect to wifi - takes several seconds. 3. Say "Alexa, turn on the light" This is stupid. Such a simple feature can be done using firmware update. Come Amazon, you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lu

customer_reviews.title: Love smart home products
customer_reviews.text: So far it works great. Initially had a problem finding the smart plug with my Alexa phone app so used app on my tablet and it worked great. You have to scan a bar code for setup. Setup is very easy and I like the fact that I don't need to download another app because it works with my Alexa app. I have not yet set up a routine because I am only using one on my living room lamp and it is super easy to just tell Alexa to the light on or off. Love smart gadgets and plan to purchase more plugs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Use this daily for a 10 amp draw espresso machine.
customer_reviews.text: I have a double-boiler espresso machine that's pretty heavy duty and this plug handles it well. I've been using it for several weeks to turn on/off the machine in the morning so I can just ask Alexa to turn on my coffee instead of going all the way downstairs to turn it on manually. By the time I'm out of the shower and dressed, the machine is at temp and I can make my morning Americano. My house is also pretty challenging for some wifi signals and this plug hasn't had a problem yet so impressed with that as well.
customer_reviews.author: JamesM

customer_reviews.title: Setup was amazing
customer_reviews.text: I just launched my Alexa app and got a notification "New smart plug found". I was able to control it immediately, I also like the sleek style.
customer_reviews.author: Rashmesh

customer_reviews.title: Directions are in tiny print not conducive to magnifying glass
customer_reviews.text: It works. BUT first you are supposed to read an instruction book in very small print with thin letters the magnifying glass does not pick up well. I am 70. Things that are low contrast are hard to read. This plug is for my mother who cannot reach the lamp. The directions should read " If you are older, you still have to read all the directions. Either use a camera to take a picture of each page and blow it up on a monitor, or find a younger person who can read the directions to you. "
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Burnt out almost caused a fire
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product up until 6 months later when at 12:30am the plug blew out and almost caused an electrical fire. I use it everyday to control my LED light which I leave on for 12 hours a day and use my Alexa or app to turn off. It’s never been unplugged or touched. My outlet still works, but the plug and the light plugged into it are completely toast :/
customer_reviews.author: Radologist

customer_reviews.title: Works for about couple of hours then has to be reset.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product. I bought it because the WeMo's were out of stock and have regretted it ever since. It set's up fine, easily in fact, but within a couple of hours it is flashing red and has to be deleted and re-added. This has been going on for 3 days straight, I will be returning it. I have 7 WeMo's and do not have any problems with them. *Updated review. I was reached out to by Amazon and offered a replacement. I have received the replacement and it works great. It seems the original one received must have been defective.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bunch
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these plugs now for about four months and these are by far the best of all the smart plugs that I have tried. They do have the occasional connectivity issues but I simply unplug them and plug them back and everything works great again. They work as advertised and work very well with any smart assistant that I have tried. Would highly recommend these to anyone looking to add smart plugs to their home.
customer_reviews.author: John Ash

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I saw the promotion for weeks on the main home page for $0.99. This is the best purchase made because I can now turn on and off the light in our living room that is plugged in behind the couch without climbing onto the couch to turn it off every night. The light only had a switch near the top so it was not the easiest to reach. Now, I can tell Alexa to turn off and on the plug and solves my problem. Thank you Alexa and Amazon for making my life just a little but easier!!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic J. Tantillo

customer_reviews.title: Blue lights bad for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: The plug has a bright blue LED to indicate power is available. I couldn’t find a way to disable the light through the app. It lights up the whole bedroom. I was able to fix the problem by covering the light with several layers of tape. The plug doesn’t work with outdoor outlets that have covers. You’ll need a one foot extension cord to get it to work. What I love about this is a routine I have setup to control my lights and start a white noise machine when I go to sleep, and stop it when I wake up. The machine stays out of sight and I don’t need to get down to turn it on/off each day.
customer_reviews.author: Lewie

customer_reviews.title: Loss of Wifi Signal will Power Off Device
customer_reviews.text: For a simple on/off plug, the Amazon Smart Plug is the simplest plug I've ever setup. Literally just plug and play. For any device that you use, where the default setting is off, it works fine. For example, I have it on my printer, which is normally powered off. However, I also have it connected to a camera where the default setting is on. However any time the wifi signal gets weak, for any reason, and the plug loses wifi connection, it will shut off the device plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: zSprawl

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: After trying cheaper models, gettin frustrates and sending them back I swallowed my pride and ponies up for actual Amazon Alexa outlet plugs. Best decision I’ve made. There was no downloading of third party apps, no endless “device not found” notifications. Really just plug and play- the way it should have been. These were up and running in under five minutes using my already installed Alexa app. I can’t begin to describe how much easier these outlets were to set up and use. Take my advice and stop trying to save pennies with those unworkable knock offs. Spent the extra to get plugs specifically designed for your Alexa. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: jon g

customer_reviews.title: Noisy plugs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup; work flawlessly with Echo and Alexa app. Down sides: the plug size esp. the width; constant high pitch buzzing sound. Prefer KASA. (Updated): Amazon rep contacted me within 24 hours after the first review. They asked about the detail of the problems I had reported and offered a replacement. The replacement plug came in a day later. It was working OK and much much quieter than the previous one. I could still hear the tiny buzzing sound only if I have my ear 1 inch close to it. Anyway, great support from Amazon. Hope they will improve their design.
customer_reviews.author: GoBeavers

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice addition to the Alexa ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased. I've had some trouble getting Alexa to call it what I want, but I think there is just a learning curve. They work though. In the living room, all I have to say is "Alexa turn on the lights" and in the bedroom I have to say "Alexa, turn on second plug". I want to rename the one in the bedroom to "Bedroom", but it is not apparent how to do that. Like I said, a learning curve. Anyway, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Rock

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Smart Plugs Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these plugs. One kept becoming unresponsive .Amazon replaced it. Now a couples of months later the same issue again. I could have bought a third party smart plug for half the price of this one and now I wish I had, since these plugs really aren't any better. I called today and was told it was a technical issue being worked on. Well a message from Amazon would have been nice since I wasted my time trying to set it up several time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Barlow

customer_reviews.title: A royal pain after a power outage
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon Smart Plug is very easy to set up and program routines to control with Amazon Alexa. However, after a power outage the prior state is not automatically restored. This is a royal pain since momentary power outages are rather frequent here. Apparently Amazon argues that this behavior is a safety feature, which doesn't make sense to me. At least Amazon should make the default state after a power outage an option. That would seem to be a reasonable request since this smart plug is considerably more expensive than other brands. I wonder if this is something that could be provided with a firmware revision?
customer_reviews.author: jsc

customer_reviews.title: almost burnt down my house
customer_reviews.text: Figured getting a legit Amazon plug would be better than the offbrand smart plugs I use around the house, but I was wrong. Plugs that are half the price have been running fine for 6 months to a year, whereas I didnt even get 30 days out of the Amazon plug before it almost burnt my house down! Plug was hooked up to a box fan, nothing huge or with a large draw (0.8-1A) and the plug claims to handle 15A max. Not sure if i got a faulty one or what, the only Amazon brand one I've owned 🤷‍♂️ might be the last
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect to network
customer_reviews.text: I had a plug for a couple of months, and it randomly stopped working. I got a replacement from Amazon, and that didn't work either. My Echo Dot recognizes the device is plugged in and present, but I keep getting "connection errors" and it never works. I'd suggest getting a smart plug that ISN'T from Amazon, since this is the second Amazon device in the last month I've had randomly stop working because of an inability to connect to the network.
customer_reviews.author: M. Najjar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay turned on anymore
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 6 months ago. For 5 months it worked fine. It ran the routine I had programmed in my Alexa app. Now it won't stay turned on. I turn it on and it will go through whatever routine occurs during the time it's on, but at some point within 24 hours it turns completely off. I can turn it back on with the switch on the side, but it eventually turns off again. Very disappointed. I was hoping I could use these to assist my disabled husband with turning on and off lights, but I don't trust it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: K Taube

customer_reviews.title: An easy answer to a frustrating question
customer_reviews.text: I was very frustrated getting one of my previously-working KASA smart plugs to work. After wasting a lot of time on it, I ordered this Amazon plug. Two minutes after unboxing, it was working seamlessly. Nice. My only quibble goes to design: The Amazon plug sits wider than the outlet plate. However, I knew that before I purchased the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Connects automatically
customer_reviews.text: The best thing??? All I had to do is plug it in and the plug was immediately recognized by Alexa and added to smart plug section of smart house in the Alexa app. I didn't have to try to get it connected and call customer support as I did with the WeMo smart plug that eventually stopped working with Alexa. I've already brought 2 and plan to buy more! Great product. Thinking about getting the microwave for my garage. If you are listening Amazon...please make your microwave in different colors. Red please or silver. Thanks. Lets tackle the kitchen! Amazon Coffee Maker would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Writer

customer_reviews.title: Love it except why not in brown or black?
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are easy to install and work very well. My only criticism is that they don't come in brown or black. Or, for that matter, why not have them in other colors as well, just like the Echo? The white is so conspicuous when most extension cords, power strips, etc. come in brown or black. I realize it's a small criticism. But, the other smart plugs that come in black all seem to be glitchy. Come on, Amazon, it's a simple thing, right?
customer_reviews.author: derf

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these and put them on a shelf. I took them out to use today for the first time. They cannot maintain solid wifi connection. There are may others out there experiencing the same issue. I've had training in wireless and have tried everything possible in my "tool kit" to resolve this intermittent loss of connectivity.... 2.4ghz only, increasing broadcast power, decreasing broadcast power, mixed mode, different locations, different ssid's and passwords, different bit-rates). Of course I bought these over a year ago and now they are out of support. Note to self never buy and assume they will work. FYI... I own a few TP-Link outlets - they work 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Quadt

customer_reviews.title: So much more fun than "Clap On! Clap Off!"
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of tries before I got this connected, only because I didn't quite understand how to set it to my wi-fi -- I realized right off that I needed to use my camera's lens to view the "bar code" to identify the device first. Doing that, it connected easily. It's on a lamp, but it'll be so much easier controlling the Christmas tree lights by voice command, rather than crawling under the tree -- or clapping! I haven't used tech support, but don't imagine I'll have difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Works well up to a point.
customer_reviews.text: We use the device for home use and to trigger indoor security lighting for when we're away from the household. Four adults (parents/2 adult children) live on site, four cell phones. Device installs on account holder's phone. Cannot reside on the four phones, just one. Such being the case, has limited practical security use for residents going and coming to empty house. The device works fine, some complications when engaged by respective resident's echos, but resolvable. Also rated at 15amp, which means you can start your coffee or crock pot remotely. Really, to best serve the household, device should have the capacity to work the same for all residents under one identified household group.
customer_reviews.author: thoughtwing

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, Thank You
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set-up! Whether you are using the provided QR code in the packaging, or pushing the button on the plug, it easily pairs with the app and is ready to take commands. I really like that I can add it to skills & routines. The plug is the full width of an outlet faceplate, so do be aware of the size when you are thinking about where to put it. It would be pretty cool if Amazon came up with an actual GFCI outlet that installs as a normal one does =)
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent, so I replaced it with a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what's wrong with Amazon's smart plugs but they are not dependable. Always having to reset the thing. Works most of the time with Alexa when its powered on. It keeps shutting off for some reason. I replaced it with a different brand and connected it to Alexa and have had no more issues. This tells me that it's the Amazon plug that is the problem. One would think that the Amazon plugs would be best to work along with Alexa, but not so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured out how to connect to my Xfinity WiFi
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a zero, I would. 2 hours of trying everything auto and manually. This will not connect to my Xfinity WiFi. My Bluetooth connected and that’s it. I wasted enough time. I will go back to Phillips Hue bulbs. They interface well. Ipdate: finally got this to work. Needs 2.4 ghz WiFi connection. xfinity gateway connects to 5 automatically. Changed my xfinity WiFi to two different names. One for 2.4 snd one for 5. Had to connect phone to 2.4 to use Alexa app to set plug. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Njsyd

customer_reviews.title: Too Spendy
customer_reviews.text: Works great and its a nice alexa addition but at $25 each its way too costly. $10-$15 would be a price range that would make me buy 2-3 more, but won't do it for $25 each. The Alexa dot is only $40- it doesn't make sense that what is essentially a light switch for Alexa would cost 62% of the master unit.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Unable to Share With Family via Alexa App
customer_reviews.text: The plug itself is great, but it cannot be shared among family members. This means that if you have multiple Alexa accounts, you have to switch to the correct account to turn the device on or off. I'm hoping Amazon fixes this oversight in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Justesen

customer_reviews.title: First "connected home" device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plug to control a fan. Initially it worked but stopped communicating with Echo after a few days. That was concerning and there wasn't a clear troubleshooting process so i sent for a replacement. Today Kelly C. called me from Amazon and walked me through a reboot of the original plug and seems to be working. Only four stars because I'm still not sure what the problem was but now i can fix it if it happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Plugged My TV into the Smart Plug
customer_reviews.text: I plugged my TV into this plug. Now I can listen to the news at bedtime and when I am ready to go to sleep I just tell Alexa to turn off the TV plug. It turns it on, too. I don't have to use the remote unless I want to change the channel or mute the TV. I don't have to reach for a remote that I end up dropping on the floor most of the time at night. I love my Smart Plug. It works every time. I have had no problems with it. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: icedcap

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working exactly two weeks after short warranty expired, piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a heater, had to have at least 15 amp capacity and this fit the bill. I did like this for ease of set up and decent price (although price has risen since I bought mine), but it has stopped working. It still connects by wifi, but it no longer turns my heater (or anything else) on or off. I've had great experience with another brand, but not with this one. I've had other electronics from China that somehow seem to know when the warranty period is, and wait until it's past before they stop working, it's mildly infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works well 75% of the time
customer_reviews.text: This product works well most of the time. Occasionally it doesn't respond and I have to restart it. But like the convenience of asking her to turn the lights on and off. The 2 lamps are hard to reach near my computer and with one sentence they can be turned on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up - and supports 5 GHz
customer_reviews.text: It is a plug. It works. Do not use it as much as I had planned, but that will hopefully come. Biggest thing is that is is very easy to set up, connected to your Alexa app (or rather eco-system). It does support WiFi on both 2.4 GHz as well as 5 GHz which can be important for people not that familiar with networking, or for people using various Mesh products (like Eero) where same SSID is used regardless of frequency and one cannot turn off broadcast on 2.4 or 5 GHz independently (which is needed in order to ensure that phone connects to 2.4 GHz when setting up products that only supports the lower frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Wellcraft19

customer_reviews.title: Great high current outlet
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the easiest to set up. Just plug it in and the Alexa app automatically finds it and names it. You can then change the name to what you want. I have other cheaper plugs that work fine for lights but not for high power or inductive loads. This plug runs a large pedestal fan great where as the others would not work. With the 15 amp rating these will be good for almost anything you can plug into them.
customer_reviews.author: BrokeDad

customer_reviews.title: Smart plug
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is too lazy to turn on the light in the middle of the night when he has to use the bathroom. I enable him with this gadget I know but it now saves me time from cleaning around the toilet and floor when he misses so Im happy about that. It was easy to install via the Alexa app. Now all my 19 YO has to say is turn on the light when nature calls and Alexa does the rest.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Completely Died After 1 Month
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was so excited about this plug that I got another one right away. I thought it was so snazzy. After 1 month, the plug just died. Like completely, fully died. At first, I thought maybe the wifi was spotty, so I tried it all over the house. Nope. Not only will it not connect, but it won't even function as a standard plug. If you plug a lamp into it, it will not turn on even manually. The light on the plug does not come on at all. It is just dead. Seriously???? Right when it becomes too late to return it, the thing completely stops working. I expected better from an Amazon product. Ugh. Soooooo disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Riley L.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Update Review: After the original review I was contacted by Amazon support personnel. One beta firmware update later and the plug has been working great. Keep in mind as advertised this is for a 2.4ghz network. I happen to be running Google WiFi with a blended 2.4/5ghz with no override capability per device. That said the product is currently running great. Orginal Review: When they work they are great but they lose connection about every other day. I have other smart plugs that do not have any issue. I use a Google WiFi network with Echo and this is the only home automation product that has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R Jones

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously easy and fast setup
customer_reviews.text: We replaced two Wemo smart plugs (a Belkin produce) that were always dropping in and out of connectivity in spite of a Ubiquiti WiFi access point 25 feet away (commercial quality WiFi equipment.) Then they stopped connecting to the Alexa skill completely. Setting up the Wemo meant installing an app on your tablet or other device, then configuring Alexa, etc., etc. This was a total PITA and took maybe 15 or 20 minutes. Threw then in the trash and replaced with the Amazon smart plug. Alexa discovered them almost immediately and that was that. Woot! These are twice the price of the Wemo smart plug but they work unlike Wemo. Well done Amazon engineering team.
customer_reviews.author: J. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: We have an Echo Dot that sends our morning wake-up radio station to our bedroom stereo. I didn't want to leave the stereo on all night waiting for Alexa's morning wake-up call, so I bought an Amazon smart plug and named it "Stereo". I have a routine set up to turn it on one minute before our morning wake-up time. During the day however, or if we want to listen our Amazon music library for an hour before we go to bed, I can just say "Alexa, turn on the stereo". We considered a Wemo smart plug, but all the reviews say Amazon's smart plug is the easiest to set-up for Alexa - and all the reviews are right.
customer_reviews.author: Aging Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this thing to work at all.  And bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these at Christmas and have been trying to connect them to Wi Fi and Alexa ever since. I keep getting error messages. I tired resetting and unplugging and re-plugging, nothing worked....nothing for two months. I finally contacted customer service. Well that was a waste of time. Finally asked if I could return and exchange for the KASA smart plug which works great (I have two of those). He sent me a return label for just one, and I have to return it for a refund. I will not be purchasing any more Amazon smart plugs, not even worth returning. I'll probably just throw them away. No good to me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Greer

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 chance
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my mom because she loved the first one so much. This one doesn't work at all, even if I switch it into the same spot the other plug worked and try to set it up. The QR code won't scan with a fire Kindle because their own products resolution is too fuzzy to do so to do a manual set up. It just straight up can't be found by any of her Alexa devices. I took it home to try at my place as well and it didn't work. I set up the first one so I know how it's supposed to function.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Becker

customer_reviews.title: Not for household accounts.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have separate prime accounts. He added me onto his household in hopes of sharing the alexa plug for the lamps in our house. It wouldn't recognize that we had a lamp if I was on my account. To turn on the lights I had to switch accounts EVERY time. I called Amazon thinking there must be a fix. Nope. I have since purchased 6 GoSund plugs and light switches. I couldn't be happier. Each of us has access to the devices and we no longer have to identify accounts, switch and issue a separate command. You figure that Amazon would be more on point with their own products. Such a shame and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Not for Programming appliances ON & OFF
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to supplement my home automation Echo devices, and KASA Outlets in use. This AMAZON PLUG is OK for ECHO commands, and scheduled ON programming. The major roadblock to this plug, "SETTING UP AUTOMATIC ON AND OFF TIMES", like an old fashioned plug on timer. I wanted to charge my Jetski battery weekly, i.e. "on and then off" after 1 hour without any actions on my part. NOT CAN DO! Ordered a bunch more of the great "KASA SMART PLUGS" that can. I Will keep the Amazon Plug to turn lights on and off via the Echo voice commands, to amuse my older house guests.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Love these Amazon Smart Plugs!
customer_reviews.text: I've installed four of these Smart Plugs in our home so far and will definitely be installing more! They work great! I have two of them set up on schedules and two others are only used occasionally so we operate them manually. The Smart Plugs have a push button on the left side to operate your light manually, so you never need to use the actual switch on the lamp....the light is now operated by the Amazon Smart Switch, whether using the app or the push button on the side. It makes it easier to have your home occupied when you're away, but also nice to have lights come on automatically on a schedule.
customer_reviews.author: California Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Plugs (when on sale)
customer_reviews.text: I love picking up these Amazon smart plugs WHEN they're running a special -- I don't think I'd pay $25 for one. At any rate, in addition to a ceiling fan we also use a stand fan in the bedroom. I've plugged that fan into a smart plug and have it set to turn on as part of the Alexia bedtime routine I created. The original reason I purchased some of these was for Christmas decorations. We'd already had timers but that meant deco was on when we weren't home and sometimes went off before we went to bed. Now, I set the interior decorations to come on when I get home and to turn off during the bedtime routine.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Smart plug
customer_reviews.text: I bought Amazon smart plug because I have an Amazon Echo dot recently. It is easy to set up Amazon smart plug by scanning a barcode. It took about 2 mins to install the plug. I use the smart plug to connect the light and use the Echo dot to control the light. It works perfectly and I just need to say "Alexa, turn on or turn off the light". It is very smart and I really like it. I would buy more to control other electrical devices in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Wen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Initial setup instructions was the only part that could have been a bit better. Two things. One, instructions did not say you needed to hold the power button down for approximately 5 seconds until the light alternately flashes blue and red to indicate pairing mode. Luckily I saw that in another review prior to purchase. Two, the interface never mentioned needing access password or anything else to hook into my WiFi. Being a semi-smart individual, I did figure this out after a minute or so of not connecting and just used the WPS button on my modem/router. Other than this, everything else works spectacularly!
customer_reviews.author: Todd J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Updates are working!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Amazon smart plugs to replace The Clapper, which had been faithful for many years--only went out when it accidentally got wet. My first set of Amazon smart plugs worked just fine for about six months, then mysteriously ceased to function. I do not know why--maybe because of a short power outage, which we have periodically around here. In any case, Amazon was a good sport about the whole thing and replaced the old ones with two new ones. These are obviously updates--they have lights that show on-off, which the old ones did not. In any case, it has not been 6 months yet, but they are off to a great start!
customer_reviews.author: T. Guymon

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  No setup required
customer_reviews.text: I have had other smart plugs and it took some messing around to get them connected to Alexa. This one was plugged in and I immediately got an alert on my phone that it was available. I just changed the name and was off and running! I was really impressed! I will be looking for sales on Black Friday! They do generally cost more. I got this on prime day for $5 as an add on. Super!
customer_reviews.author: California

product_meta.title: Amazon Smart Plug, works with Alexa – A Certified for Humans Device
feature_bullets: Amazon Smart Plug works with Alexa to add voice control to any outlet.
Certified for Humans - Struggle-free, tinker-free, stress-free. No patience needed—it's actually simple.
Schedule lights, fans, and appliances to turn on and off automatically, or control them remotely when you’re away.
Simple to set up and use—plug in, open the Alexa app, and start using your voice.
Compact design keeps your second outlet free.
No smart home hub required—set up routines and schedules through the Alexa app.
